name: Wind I
core: A first stirring suggests the matter is ready to move, provided the direction is noticed before the speed is admired.
shadow: Movement becomes drift when motion is taken as proof of progress.
astralNote: Its astral note points toward a quick but thoughtful beginning.
umbralNote: Its umbral note suggests listening to the current before stepping into it.

name: Wind II
core: An exchange of currents suggests movement becomes useful when two forces learn how to answer one another cleanly.
shadow: Exchange becomes instability when every shift is mirrored without judgment.
astralNote: Its astral note indicates responsive collaboration can advance the work.
umbralNote: Its umbral note suggests letting the competing currents settle into pattern first.

name: Wind III
core: Circulation suggests ideas, effort, and speech should be allowed to pass freely enough to keep the pattern alive.
shadow: Circulation becomes noise when movement multiplies without carrying substance.
astralNote: Its astral note points toward keeping the exchange active and purposeful.
umbralNote: Its umbral note suggests clearing static before adding another voice.

name: Wind IV
core: A settled draft suggests boundaries and pacing are needed if the movement is to remain coherent.
shadow: Structure becomes confinement when the air is never allowed to shift.
astralNote: Its astral note indicates form can support a more effective movement.
umbralNote: Its umbral note suggests slowing the tempo until the path is clearer.

name: Wind V
core: Opposing gusts suggest the field is unsettled and may resist any attempt to force one clean direction too early.
shadow: Conflict becomes confusion when every cross-current is treated as equal truth.
astralNote: Its astral note points toward identifying the strongest line before committing effort.
umbralNote: Its umbral note suggests waiting until the turbulence loses some force.

name: Wind VI
core: A favorable current suggests movement can resume with more grace than force if the opening is used wisely.
shadow: Advantage becomes vanity when the easy current is mistaken for permanent support.
astralNote: Its astral note indicates an opening is present and can be used cleanly.
umbralNote: Its umbral note suggests keeping enough reserve to adjust if the current turns.

name: Wind VII
core: Elevation suggests perspective can be gained by rising just far enough above the pressure to see its pattern.
shadow: Perspective becomes detachment when height is used to escape consequence.
astralNote: Its astral note points toward using a broader view to guide action.
umbralNote: Its umbral note suggests remaining observant before descending into the matter again.

name: Wind VIII
core: Rapid passage suggests developments may outrun hesitation, rewarding clear timing and flexible response.
shadow: Speed becomes fragmentation when sequence is abandoned in favor of sheer pace.
astralNote: Its astral note points toward timely movement and swift coordination.
umbralNote: Its umbral note suggests cutting speed slightly so coherence is preserved.

name: Wind IX
core: A long-moving current suggests endurance is possible when the path remains adaptive and not rigidly fixed.
shadow: Endurance becomes wandering when no destination remains visible.
astralNote: Its astral note indicates continued movement still has value if the line stays intentional.
umbralNote: Its umbral note suggests checking whether the course still serves the question.

name: Wind X
core: Dissipation suggests the cycle is dispersing and should not be forced back into a shape it has already outgrown.
shadow: Release becomes evasion when dissolution is chosen simply to avoid responsibility.
astralNote: Its astral note points toward letting the old pattern disperse so a truer one can form.
umbralNote: Its umbral note supports dispersal, reduction, and an unforced ending.
